comments.body: Should do this. Like how you can put a saddle on a pig but on a turtle

I say turtles should be tamable with both sea grass and tropical fish, although only sea grass puts them in "love" mode.

Also, maybe they shouldn't grant the player breath underwater; sorta completely undermines the Turtle Shell (and also Potions of Water Breathing). How about instead it grants players a level of respiration that stacks with enchaned helmets/ Turtle Shell?

This just may seem like a glorified boat, but while on a turtle, players could also get the dolphin's grace buff as they are technically in the water.
I would suggest that turtles be controlled like a sort-of-mix between player swimming and horses: the angle you're looking determines what directions the movement keys...move you. Say you look straight down: W swims downward as expected, A and D move side to side, but S swims upwards.

Complicated? Yes. Cool? Yes. Worth it? I think so.
If Minecraft dousn't add this, I think this should exist in a mod... cuz it dousn't... I looked. =/
NO!
You know what I'm sorry. This is actually a great idea. While we're at it we should also increase the creeper spawn rate and make them fly. That's maybe an even better idea!

since the Allay is like a Vex I don't think it should ever be possible to breed them.

However, I think it should be possible for the Enoker to summon one if an Allay is already within range of it.

players would be able to bring an Allay with them to pick up raid items and get a % chance of spawning another on, however the Vex would attack the Allay. Players would need to protect their Allay, healing it with potions to keep it around.

Heyy, I've got an idea on how should the Allay be summoned! As someone posted here, it shoud be related to the Vexes, but, instead of having the evoker summoning them, I think you should be able to "revive" the Vexes into Allays. It would work like that:

First, you would get the Vex's attention by playing some music on a jukebox. It would slow down (as if it remembers that it was an Alley before) and wander around the jukebox, but it would still be able to hit you.

Then, you would have do disarm it by blocking an attack with a shield.

Once it has no weapon, you should give it a totem of undying and then it would dance and turn back into an allay (consuming the totem).

I do think this is a really cool ideia because it makes the allay renewable but makes it hard, as finding one is right now, also it gives us a great lore and adds something other than breeding!
I think soul sand should be involved in summoning Allays. Once the Allay is summoned, the soul sand becomes normal sand.
i think it should be summoned by the song of note blocks in the trailer in the mob vote
It will save alot of time by just summoning instead of just blindly finding it

I love this idea! Maybe a special music disc obtained from the deep dark cities can duplicate/summon a new allay out of thin air if there is another allay around (only once per disc, and played all the way thru). This would give the deep dark an item worth looting: a one-time use summon disc

This would maintain the gameplay of rescuing an allay from an outpost or mansion, but add more mystery and a unique spawning mechanic

An idea I had seen regarding messenger birds was the use of lodestone compasses. Give the messenger bird a book or a bundle(the message), then equip it with a lodestone compass so it flies to a specific location that players would know to look for it. It doesn't do players any good to spend an hour looking all over their base for their bird, it needs to go to the same spot every time. Using a lodestone compass means the bird will have a target to navigate to. Give birds 2 slots for a lodestone compass and the cargo. This allows the bird to travel to its destination with the first compass and then be sent to another base with another compass & delivery. This would be an amazing feature for role play servers, as private communication between bases would be possible, and allow players to continue with other activities while the message is being delivered. 

Birds should be able to deliver items the player has found and wants to send home immediately, so they aren't at risk of losing it. It can be only one non-armor or weapon item per bird, and the player can only carry one bird. If the player just looted the Woodland Mansion and wants to make sure a totem of undying makes it home, send it home using a carrier bird.

Birds should be able to be intercepted or lured away from their destination via food by players who know where the bird will travel. This would be good for multiplayer, where players can intercept messages and items by getting close to the bird or know its flight path.

I not sure if you've heard of the axodile, but this idea seems similar to that. Maybe they could be related? https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/community/posts/360009229652-The-Axodile-the-Shark-that-Minecraft-Needs-  Also you should vote for the axodile. Its cool

I honestly love this concept however, I do have a few more ideas for you to include. 

  1. Remove the scale boots, this concept of 'fish scale boots' is a good idea, however doesn't quite fit with how Minecraft would normally make use of.
  2. The bleeding concept as a status effect is probably my favorite. I would like this to be improved so that when your moving it effects are quicker as well as a comment earlier given that it attracts more Agorans (like how piranhas hunt).
  3. Instead of only becoming hostile when attacking, how about its territorial and attacks you in a certain radius until you leave its territory.

Very unique concept! I really like this idea! Though I don't understand why you would tame it, as the only thing you get from it is to shear it and that makes it wild again. They either shouldn't be tamed, or there should be some incentive to tame it that would make players seek people out. When introducing a mob, you want some incentive to interact with it, this being taming it, hunting it, or even just items it produces! I want to see this mob added, but it lacks incentive, if you edit this mob, ask this question: Why would players seek this out?

I also believe pangolins would be an amazing edition to the game. Besides them being an extremely adorable creature, it would be great for awareness, just like the axolotl.

I was thinking something like:

https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/community/posts/21347836805901-Cursed-Skeletons-Minecraft-1-21-Trial-Spawner-Mob-Idea

Will this mob have a use to players? Two potential uses are as an alarm/distraction (if a pheasant creates noise when fleeing) or a source of larger tail feathers, which may have its own uses (weak, pre-end elytra material or camouflaging armor). Without a use, this mob could be subject to the same treatment as polar bears.

Great idea. To make it more useful, rather than just a decorated chicken, perhaps it's feathers can be used to create stronger arrows, arrows that go further and inflict more damage. The pheasant could also act in a similar way to a bees nest, meaning a limited number of pheasants could naturally spawn alongside the nest, and would roam in a 30x30 block area that is their territory.

As a fun goof, pheasants will always bolden around chickens and scare any chickens entering their territory. Not only would that be funny to watch, it could be use to herd chickens. By placing nest with pheasants around you could create areas that effectively block chickens from passing through.

Mabye a Pheasant Nest in Woods and Plaines where you could find Pheasant eggs and with the nest you could put other eggs to give a better hatch rate. Also Pheasant meat would be great as Pheasants would be more rarer than the chicken mabye the Pheasant meat could fill up one more hunger bar than Chicken meat. Just a thought hope it can help!

There should be 2 variants of lynx. First the North American lynx, aka bobcat, it spawns mostly in rocky biomes, it can be found in mountains, and plains biomes, stone shore, savanna, and badlands. The second variant is the Canadian lynx, aka mountain lions, they are a larger variant, they spawn in cold and snowy biomes that are mostly either rocky, or icy. They can spawn in snowy extreme hills, snowy mountains, snowy taiga, and ice spikes biomes. Both variants spawn in groups of one to eight, and have a 40 percent chance of being a baby. they are neutral, but will run away if you get to close, or will become hostile if attached by the player, or if it gets too close to it's young. They kill rabbits, foxes, pigs, cows, sheep. and will not approach wolves, and neither will the wolves approach them. they can be tamed through breeding (possibly) and can be fed with any type of meat.

@TheFriendlyPine It's been a while but I have another mob that is tamable that is the rival of Titanus, it's posting and the name is "Radious, the Terror of the Skies". She is something like a boss but different being a tamable mob as she is neutral to mobs and hostile to Titanus, the Wither, and the Ender Dragon.

Then, in the ender dragon's last breath, she screeches to her creator, Darkn. He (I say he, but really Guardians don't really have genders) shows up, (His aura would have been enough to make him surrender, but Titanus was prideful), resurrects her easily and makes her strong enough to beat that weak mutant Titanus, and scolds her that if she cannot beat Titanus, she won't be able to destroy all of humanity and beat the other Guardians {not those pushover guardians of underwater temples, I mean the nearly all-powerful immortal Guardians of magic [they once barely sealed him in a chest (using all of their power), but he eventually escaped when a tomb raider named Pandora opened it]}. Darkn shows Titanus who is boss. Titanus never stood a chance against the Guardian of Darkness.
